content: Currently, docs#analyticOrderAt is defined only for functions defined on the base field. WDYT about redefining it as the supremum of n such that f z = O((dist z c) ^ n)?
This way it will work for functions f : E -> F too.
Is the order notion really useful for functions E -> F? Imagine a function vanishing along a hypersurface but not in a transverse direction, then it would have order 0 but this wouldn't say much.
I thought a bit more, and the only use case I had in mind can be expressed by a simple _ = O(_), so I'm closing this thread.
Yury G. Kudryashov has marked this topic as resolved.
